metadata.title: CVE-2022-44033 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - negligible
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel through 6.0.6.drivers/char/pcmcia/cm4040_cs.c has a race condition and resultantuse-after-free if a physically proximate attacker removes a PCMCIA devicewhile calling open(), aka a race condition between cm4040_open() andreader_detach().

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-44033` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-5-generic - 6.5.0-5.5
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-5-generic - 6.5.0-5.5
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-5-generic-64k - 6.5.0-5.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1005-aws - 6.5.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1004-azure - 6.5.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1004-gcp - 6.5.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-5-lowlatency - 6.5.0-5.5.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-5-lowlatency-64k - 6.5.0-5.5.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1005-oracle - 6.5.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1002-raspi - 6.5.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1002-starfive - 6.5.0-1002.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-5.5').
linux-aws package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1005.5').
linux-azure package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1004.4').
linux-gcp package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1004.4').
linux-ibm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support, was needs-triage').
linux-lowlatency package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-5.5.1').
linux-oracle package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1005.5').
linux-raspi package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1002.2').
linux-starfive package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1002.3').
